meanings.definition: The part of the small intestine between the duodenum and the ileum.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the jejunums play a crucial role in absorbing nutrients.
meanings.sent2: During digestion, food passes through the jejunums to be further processed.
meanings.sent3: The jejunums were so busy absorbing nutrients that they didn't notice the stomach's grumbling sounds.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like the jejunums, absorbing every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The jejunums resembled tiny sponges, soaking up all the essential vitamins and minerals.

meanings.sent1: The presentation was so jejunums that most of the audience fell asleep.

meanings.sent3: The party decorations looked jejunums, like they were missing something fun.
